command.description: Add a specific song from spotify, youtube, the current queue or any URL to the specified local playlist. Which source is used is decided by the used arguments or the default source and default list source properties. Spotify search queries support the Spotify query syntax (i.e. the "artist:", "album:" and "track:" filters). To add tracks to the queue see the queue command.

argument.description: Mandatory argument to define the playlist to which you want to add the tracks.
Add items from the current queue to the specified playlist. The to argument may be dropped when using this argument. E.g. add %2$squeue my list.

example.title: Add a specific track
Add tracks from the current queue to a list
Add tracks from a url

command.description: Answer a question asked by the bot. Commands like the play command may ask you to specify what track you meant if several options where found.

example.title: Choose option with key 2
Choose options 2, 4 and 6

command.description: Create an empty local playlist with the given name.

example.title: Create a playlist called "my list"

command.description: Delete the local playlist with the given name.

example.title: Delete a playlist called "my list"

command.description: Export the current tracks in the queue to a new local list.

example.title: Create a playlist called "my list" with tracks from the current queue

command.description: Lists all available commands and their descriptions or provides help with a specific command.

example.title: Get help with the play command

command.description: Login to spotify. This sends you a link to the spotify login page which then redirects to the botify callback.

example.title: Login to Spotify.

command.description: Resume the paused playback, play the current track in the queue or play the specified track, video or playlist. Can play any URL or search youtube and spotify tracks or lists and also local playlists. Local playlists, like the queue, can contain tracks from any source (YouTube, Spotify and URL). Spotify search queries support the Spotify query syntax (i.e. the "artist:", "album:" and "track:" filters). Which source is used is decided by the used arguments or the default source and default list source properties.

example.title: Play the current queue or unpause playback
Play a specific track from Spotify
Play a track from a specific artist and album

command.example: %1$splay from the inside artist:linkin park album:meteora

example.title: Play a URL
Play a video from YouTube
Play a playlist from YouTube, showing a selection of 5 results
Play a YouTube playlist
Play a Spotify playlist
Play a Spotify playlist from the current user's library

command.description: Pause the current playback.

Display the current queue or add a youtube video or playlist, spotify track or playlist, local playlist or any URL to the current queue. Spotify search queries support the Spotify query syntax (i.e. the "artist:", "album:" and "track:" filters). Which source is used is decided by the used arguments or the default source and default list source properties.

example.title: Display the queue widget
Add a specific track from Spotify to the queue
Add a track from a specific artist and album

command.example: %1$squeue from the inside artist:linkin park album:meteora

example.title: Add tracks from a local playlist to the queue
Add tracks from a Spotify playlist to the queue
Add tracks from a Spotify playlist in the current user's library to the queue
Add a YouTube playlist to the queue
Add a YouTube playlist to the queue, showing a selection of 5 results

command.description: Remove an item from a local playlist. Put either the full title of the YouTube video or the Spotify track name. If it was a track added by URL from a different source you can either remove it via its title or URL.

argument.description: Mandatory argument to specify the playlist from which to remove the items.
Remove items by their index. You can also provide an index range like %2$sbotify remove 13-19 %2$sfrom list. This includes starting and end index.

example.title: Remove a Spotify track from a playlist
Remove an item added by URL
Remove the track at position 3 from a playlist
Remove positions 13 through 19 from a playlist

command.description: Change the name of the bot. This name will then be used as the bot's nickname (if the bot has the permission to change it) and can be used as command prefix instead of '$botify'

example.title: Name the bot "Patrice"

command.description: Toggles repeat for either the entire queue (repeat %2$sall) or the current track (repeat %2$sone).

argument.description: Toggle repeat for the current track.
Toggle repeat for all tracks in the queue. This is the default option.

example.title: Repeat the full queue
Repeat the current track

command.description: Go back to the previous track in the queue. You can provide a number to rewind more than one track.

example.title: Rewind to the previous track in the queue
Rewind 6 tracks

command.description: Search for YouTube and Spotify tracks or playlists and local playlists or list all local playlists. Spotify search queries support the Spotify query syntax (i.e. the "artist:", "album:" and "track:" filters). Which source is used is decided by the used arguments or the default source and default list source properties.

argument.description: Search for Spotify track or playlist. This supports Spotify query syntax (i.e. the filters "artist:", "album:", etc.). This is the default option when searching for tracks.
Search for YouTube video or playlist.
Search for a playlist.
Search for a local playlist or list all of them. This is default when searching for lists.
Limit search to Spotify tracks or playlists in the current user's library. This requires a Spotify login.

rule.errorMessage: Argument 'own' may only be used with Spotify.

argument.description: Show a selection of YouTube playlists / videos or Spotify tracks to chose from. May be assigned a value from 1 to 20: %2$sselect=5

rule.errorMessage: Argument 'select' may only be used with YouTube or Spotify.

argument.description: Search for a Spotify album.

rule.errorMessage: Argument 'album' may only be used with Spotify.

argument.description: Search an episode of a podcast on Spotify. Note that this argument is only required when searching, not when entering a URL.

rule.errorMessage: Argument 'episode' may only be used with Spotify.

argument.description: Search a podcast show on Spotify. Note that this argument is only required when searching, not when entering a URL.

rule.errorMessage: Argument 'podcast' may only be used with Spotify.

argument.description: Specify the ISO 3166-1 country code of the target spotify market. Used to search a Spotify item in a specific country different from the default of this Botify instance.

rule.errorMessage: Argument 'market' may only be used with Spotify.
'%3$s' is not a valid ISO 3166-1 country code

example.title: List all local playlists
Search for a specific local list
Search for a Spotify track
Search for a Spotify playlist
Search for a YouTube playlist
Search for a YouTube playlist, showing a selection of 5 results

command.description: Toggles shuffle for this guild's queue. This generates a random order in which each track only appears once.
Skip to the next track in the queue or skip the specified amount of tracks. You can provide a number to skip more than one track.

example.title: Skip to the next item in the queue
Skip 6 tracks

command.description: Stop playback and empty the queue.
Upload the items from a local list to a new Spotify playlist. This ignores elements that are not Spotify tracks.

example.title: Upload playlist "my list"

command.description: Add or remove a role required to run a certain command or list all commands and who they are available to. By default all commands are available to each user, except for this command and the commands in the scripting category which initially are only available to administrator roles. But as soon as a role has been added only those members with said role can use the command. If you add several roles to one command a member only requires one of those roles. The guild owner or members with administrator roles can always use any command.

argument.description: Specify the roles to grant access for.
Specify the roles to remove access privileges from when using the %2$sdeny argument.
Grant the selected commands to the selected roles. Limits the command to the selected roles if no roles were previously defined.
Denies a role from using a command that has previously been added as a granted role
Clear all restrictions for a command to make it available for everyone.

rule.errorMessage: No commands selected! Either select commands (comma separated) or use the %2$sall or %2$scategory arguments

argument.description: Manage a category of commands. Use the help command to show all categories.
Manage all commands at once. The inline arguments %2$sto and %2$sfor are not required with this argument.
Make the selected commands available only to the guild owner and administrator roles.

rule.errorMessage: No commands selected! Either select commands (comma separated) or use the %2$sall or %2$scategory arguments

example.title: Add playbackmanager to the roles that can use command play
Remove playbackmanager from the roles that can use command add
Clear all restrictions for command shuffle
grant all commands to the manager role
grant all commands in the playback category to role playbackmanager
make command add available to guild owner only

command.description: Log out from Spotify.
Show various analytics about this bot.
Clear the current queue of all tracks (except the currently playing track).
Skip the given amount of seconds or minutes in the current track.

argument.description: Forward the given amount of minutes.
Forward the given amount of seconds. This is default.

example.title: Forward 110 seconds
Forward 2 minutes

command.description: Rewind the given amount of seconds or minutes in the current track.

argument.description: Reverse the given amount of minutes.
Reverse the given amount of seconds. This is default.

example.title: Rewind 110 seconds
Rewind 2 minutes

command.description: Change the music volume. Enter a value between 1 and 200.

Create or delete a command preset or show all saved presets. Command presets can be used as shortcuts for lengthy commands or creating an alias for a command. Presets han hold one variable marked by "%%s" that may be assigned a value when using the preset. Syntax to create a preset: [preset] %2$sas [name]. Mind that if your preset contains arguments you either need to put the preset in quotation marks or escape the argument prefixes using the escape character '\\'; see the examples for references.

argument.description: Defines the name that will be used to call this preset. This argument is mandatory except when using the delete argument.
Delete an existing preset by its name.

example.title: Create a preset to add a track to your favourite list like: %1$sfav numb
Create a preset to play a local list like: %1$spl my list
Create an alias for command forward: %1$sff 20
List all local playlist with one word: %1$slist
Create a preset to play one of the current user's Spotify playlists
List all saved presets
Delete a saved preset

command.description: Set a custom command prefix. Can be used instead of "$botify" or the bot name to start a command.

example.title: Set the command prefix to "." to start a command like this: .play numb

command.description: Move one or several items in a botify playlist to a different index. When moving items down the playlist the items will end up behind the track that is currently at the target index or before when moving items upwards. When entering an index range to move it includes the start and end index. Indices are human, meaning they start at 1. To view full playlists with all indices search the list (%1$ssearch %2$slist my list) and then click the view full list link.

argument.description: Mandatory argument to specify the target index.
Mandatory argument to define the playlist where you want to move the tracks.

example.title: Move the item that is currently at index 5 to index 10
Move the items that are currently in range 4 - 6 (including start & end) down between the items that are currently at index 10 and 11.
Move the items that are currently in range 14 - 16 (including start & end) up between the items that are currently at index 9 and 10.

command.description: Add a track to a botify playlist. This command is an extension to the add command that inserts the tracks at a specific index within the playlist rather than adding them to the end of the list. This moves all items at and below the specified index down and inserts the new tracks starting at the provided index.

argument.description: Mandatory argument to define the index at which to insert the tracks.

example.title: Add tracks to the start of a playlist
Insert tracks at index 10

command.description: List all properties or change the value of a property. Properties are used to customize the bot. For example the "color" property changes the colour theme or "playback notification" changes whether you receive "Now playing..." messages.

argument.description: Toggles a property with a boolean value (e.g. "playback notification") to its opposite value
Set a property to the specified value. E.g. property default source %2$sset youtube.
Describe what a property does.

example.title: list all properties
set the color of botify messages to blue
set the color to Spotify green
toggle playback notifications
set the default service when searching for a track
set the default service when searching for a list
set the argument prefix to '-' to make commands look like this: %1$splay -youtube vid
set the amount of seconds after which success and error messages disappear to 20
disable the automatic removal of success and error messages
set the default text channel to 'bot'
describe property 'color'

command.description: Shows the most popular tracks and artists for this guild and globally

Sends all currently running commands an interrupt signal and cancels all queued commands. Not all operations are affected by the interrupt signal but those that actually might take a long time, such as loading a large YouTube playlist, usually are. Use this command carefully as an emergency break if, for example, someone spammed to bot with large commands.
Synchronise a botify playlist with an external playlist. In practice this the same as the add command but empties the selected list first.

argument.description: Specify the local botify playlist to synchronise the remote playlist with.

example.title: Sync the contents of a botify playlist with a YouTube playlist
Sync the contents of a botify playlist with a Spotify playlist
Sync the contents of a botify playlist with a URL

command.description: Clears a botify playlist of all items.

example.title: Empty the botify playlist 'favs'

command.description: Evaluate a groovy script. This command simply executes a groovy script and, if not null, prints the result.

example.title: Provided variables:

command.example:
```css #context context for the current command execution
#command the command instance for this eval command invocation
#messages an instance of the MessageService class
#guildContext the GuildContext instance for current guild, derived from context
#playback the AudioPlayback instance for current guild, derived from context
#guild the Guild instance (JDA entity) representing the current guild, derived from context
#message the Message instance (JDA entity) representing the message sent by the user, derived from context
#channel the MessageChannel instance (JDA entity) representing the channel the message was sent from, derived from context
#member the Member instance (JDA entity) representing the guild member that sent the message, derived from context
#user the User instance (JDA entity) representing the user that sent the message, derived from context ```

example.title: Get member count of current guild
Add reactions to your message, play a Spotify album, answer with the first option and send a message
Send an embed message

command.example: ```groovy %1$seval def embedBuilder = new EmbedBuilder() embedBuilder.setTitle('Title') embedBuilder.setDescription('description') context.channel.sendMessage(embedBuilder.build()).submit() return null ```

example.title: Enable shuffle if disabled, play a playlist and skip to title 'Numb'

command.description: Manage custom command interceptors. A command interceptor is a piece of code that is executed before running each command. Internally they are used to check permissions, parse the command input, check argument rules etc. The groovy scripting sandbox allows you to create additional custom interceptors that are queried and executed by the last interceptor in the chain before the actual command is executed. This command may create a new interceptor, delete an existing interceptor, display an interceptor or list all interceptors. Note that commands executed in scripts via 'command.run()' do not trigger custom command interceptors to avoid cycles. The interceptor and finalizer commands also do not trigger interceptors / finalizers so that malicious interceptors may always be deleted. See the help page for the eval command for available variables.

example.title: Create an interceptor that adds an 'ok hand' reaction to each message upon execution

Create an interceptor that introduces a chance to get rickrolled when entering a play command. This generates a random number up to 10000 and checks if it is divisible by 33, increase numbers to reduce likeness of rickroll.
Show interceptor 'rickroll'
List all interceptors
Delete interceptor 'rickroll'

command.description: This command manages persistent scripts for the groovy sandbox. In addition to the variables mentioned by the help page for the eval command, this command offers an 'input' variable to be used in scripts that represents additional user input. Note that scripts can be run directly like normal commands or presets, thus '%1$smyscript myinput' is equivalent to '%1$sscript %2$sinvoke="myscript" myinput'.

argument.description: Specify the identifier of the script you want to execute. Note that scripts can be run directly like normal commands or presets, thus '%1$smyscript myinput' is equivalent to '%1$sscript %2$sinvoke="myscript"' myinput.

example.title: Create a script that adds a reaction to the command message, searches the album 'Meteora' and plays the first result
Create a script that enables shuffle if disabled
Create a script that skips to the specified track name in the queue (checking queue.hasNext with ignoreRepeat = true to avoid infinite loop)
Show script 'meteora'
List all scripts
Delete script 'meteora'
Run script 'skipTo' with input 'Numb'; this is equivalent to typing '%1$sskipTo Numb'

command.description: Creates and manages script interceptors that are executed after the command finished successfully. If the command runs into an error finalizers are not executed. Essentially "finalizers" are just interceptors that are queried and executed by a different internal interceptor that runs after the one that executes the command. Like the interceptor command running this command will not trigger custom command interceptors / finalizers. For more about interceptors see the help page for the interceptor command.

example.title: Create a finalizer that deletes the command message after the command completes
Show finalizer 'deleteMessage'
List all finalizers
Delete finalizer 'deleteMessage'

command.description: Connect a web client. After using this command you can DM me the token provided by the web client. This will prepare a session connected to this guild and user enabling the client to connect via the token.

example.title: Prepare a session based on this guild and user

command.description: Restarts the bot

argument.description: Disables alerting active guilds about the restart.
The maximum amount of seconds to wait for pending actions to complete.

command.description: Stops the bot

argument.description: Disables alerting active guilds about the shutdown.
The maximum amount of seconds to wait for pending actions to complete.

valueCheck.errorMessage: Value needs to be 0 or greater

command.description: Update the bot if the current branch needs to be rebased. Performs a rebase and maven clean install if necessary. A restart might be required if an update was pulled.
Load a document from the embedDocuments or list them.
Deletes data associated with guilds the bot is no longer a part of. Discord listeners will be suspended during that time.

argument.description: Disables alerting active guilds about the cleanup and associated suspension.

command.description: Executes a Java garbage collection to manually clean up memory when convenient
Displays the current calculated usage of the daily YouTube API quota.

argument.description: Search for a youtube, spotify or botify playlist. Note that this argument is only required when searching, not when entering a URL.

Search for a Spotify track, list or album. This supports Spotify query syntax (i.e. the filters "artist:", "album:", etc.). Note that this argument is only required when searching, not when entering a URL.
Search a YouTube video or playlist. Note that this argument is only required when searching, not when entering a URL.
Limit search to Spotify tracks, lists or albums that are in the current user's library. This requires a Spotify login.

argument.description: Search for a local botify playlist.
Search for a Spotify album. Note that this argument is only required when searching, not when entering a URL.

argument.description: Search a track on soundcloud. Note that this argument is only required when searching, not when entering a URL.
Search an episode of a podcast on Spotify. Note that this argument is only required when searching, not when entering a URL.
